content:
ApplicationTrustCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of ApplicationTrust objects. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
[System.Security.SecurityCritical]
public sealed class ApplicationTrustCollection : System.Collections.ICollection
Inheritance
System.Object
ApplicationTrustCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

ApplicationTrust objects encapsulate security decisions about an application.

Properties

Count

Gets the number of items contained in the collection.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of items contained in the collection.

IsSynchronized

Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).

public bool IsSynchronized { get; }
Value
Boolean

false in all cases.

Item(Int32)

Gets the ApplicationTrust object located at the specified index in the collection.

public System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust this[int index] { get; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the object within the collection.

Value
ApplicationTrust

The ApplicationTrust object at the specified index in the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is greater than or equal to the count of objects in the collection.

InvalidOperationException

index is negative.

Remarks

Use this method to get a ApplicationTrust object from the ApplicationTrustCollection at the specified index.

Item(String)

Gets the ApplicationTrust object for the specified application.

public System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust this[string appFullName] { get; }
appFullName
String

The full name of the application.

Value
ApplicationTrust

The ApplicationTrust object for the specified application, or null if the object cannot be found.

Remarks

The ApplicationIdentity property of each ApplicationTrust object in the collection is examined for a FullName property value that matches the application specified by the appFullName parameter.

SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

public object SyncRoot { get; }
Value
System.Object

The object to use to synchronize access to the collection.

Remarks

The default implementation returns the current application trust object.

Methods

Add(ApplicationTrust)

Adds an element to the collection.

public int Add (System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust trust);
trust
ApplicationTrust

The ApplicationTrust object to add.

Returns
Int32

The index at which the new element was inserted.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

trust is null.

ArgumentException

The stem.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity* property of the ApplicationTrust specified in trust is null.

Remarks

The ApplicationTrust object is added to the end of the collection. To remove an application trust that you previously added, use the Remove method.

AddRange(ApplicationTrust[])

Copies the elements of the specified ApplicationTrust array to the end of the collection.

public void AddRange (System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust[] trusts);
trusts
ApplicationTrust[]

An array of type ApplicationTrust containing the objects to add to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

trusts is null.

ArgumentException

The stem.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity* property of an ApplicationTrust specified in trust is null.

Remarks

The ApplicationTrust objects contained in the trusts array are appended to the end of the collection.

To remove a range of application trusts that you previously added, use the RemoveRange method.

AddRange(ApplicationTrustCollection)

Copies the elements of the specified ApplicationTrustCollection to the end of the collection.

public void AddRange (System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection trusts);
trusts
ApplicationTrustCollection

A ApplicationTrustCollection containing the objects to add to the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

trusts is null.

ArgumentException

The stem.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity* property of an ApplicationTrust specified in trust is null.

Remarks

The ApplicationTrust objects contained in trusts are appended to the end of the collection.

You can use the AddRange method to quickly add another collection of application trust objects to the collection instead of manually adding each application trust to the collection using the Add method.

To remove a range of application trusts that you previously added, use the RemoveRange method.

Clear()

Removes all the application trusts from the collection.

public void Clear ();
Exceptions
ArgumentException

The stem.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity* property of an item in the collection is null.

Remarks

Each ApplicationTrust in the collection is identified by its ApplicationIdentity property. If the value of the ApplicationIdentity property for any ApplicationTrust object in the collection is null, an ArgumentException is thrown.

CopyTo(ApplicationTrust[],Int32)

Copies the entire collection to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

public void CopyTo (System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust[] array, int index);
array
ApplicationTrust[]

The one-dimensional array of type ApplicationTrust that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection.

index
Int32

The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

array is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than the lower bound of array.

ArgumentException

array is multidimensional.

-or-

The number of elements in the ApplicationTrustCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.

Remarks

Caution

All the application trusts in the collection are copied into the array starting at the specified index location, overwriting any existing data within the range of objects copied into the array.

Find(ApplicationIdentity,ApplicationVersionMatch)

Gets the application trusts in the collection that match the specified application identity.

public System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection Find (ApplicationIdentity applicationIdentity, System.Security.Policy.ApplicationVersionMatch versionMatch);
applicationIdentity
ApplicationIdentity

An ApplicationIdentity object describing the application to find.

versionMatch
ApplicationVersionMatch

One of the ApplicationVersionMatch values.

Returns
ApplicationTrustCollection

An ApplicationTrustCollection containing all matching ApplicationTrust objects.

Remarks

The application trust is optionally selected by an exact version match, based on the value of the versionMatch parameter.

GetEnumerator()

Returns an object that can be used to iterate over the collection.

public System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustEnumerator GetEnumerator ();
Returns
ApplicationTrustEnumerator

An ApplicationTrustEnumerator that can be used to iterate over the collection.

Remarks

The ApplicationTrustEnumerator implements the System.Collections.IEnumerator interface that allows you to move within a collection.

Use the Current property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.

Use the MoveNext method to move to the next item in the collection.

Use the Reset method to move the enumerator to its initial position.

Note

After you create the enumerator, or use the Reset method to reposition the enumerator to the start of the collection, you must then call the MoveNext method to position the enumerator to the first item. Otherwise, the item represented by the Current property is undefined.

Remove(ApplicationTrust)

Removes the specified application trust from the collection.

public void Remove (System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust trust);
trust
ApplicationTrust

The ApplicationTrust object to remove.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

trust is null.

ArgumentException

The stem.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust.ApplicationIdentity* property of the ApplicationTrust object specified by trust is null.

Remarks

The entire collection is searched, and all instances of the specified application trust are removed.

The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions. The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.

Remove(ApplicationIdentity,ApplicationVersionMatch)

Removes all application trust objects that match the specified criteria from the collection.

public void Remove (ApplicationIdentity applicationIdentity, System.Security.Policy.ApplicationVersionMatch versionMatch);
applicationIdentity
ApplicationIdentity

The ApplicationIdentity of the ApplicationTrust object to be removed.

versionMatch
ApplicationVersionMatch

One of the ApplicationVersionMatch values.

Remarks

The application trust can be identified by an exact version match, dependent upon the value of the versionMatch parameter. The Find method is used to locate all matching application trusts, and the matching items are removed from the collection.

The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions. The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.

RemoveRange(ApplicationTrust[])

Removes the application trust objects in the specified array from the collection.

public void RemoveRange (System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust[] trusts);
trusts
ApplicationTrust[]

A one-dimensional array of type ApplicationTrust that contains items to be removed from the current collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

trusts is null.

Remarks

The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions. The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.

RemoveRange(ApplicationTrustCollection)

Removes the application trust objects in the specified collection from the collection.

public void RemoveRange (System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrustCollection trusts);
trusts
ApplicationTrustCollection

An ApplicationTrustCollection that contains items to be removed from the currentcollection.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

trusts is null.

Remarks

The objects that follow the removed objects move up to occupy the vacated positions. The indexes of the objects that are moved are also updated.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the elements of the ICollection to the specified Array, starting at the specified Array index.

void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from the ICollection. The Array must have zero-based indexing.

index
Int32

The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

array is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero.

ArgumentException

array is multidimensional.

-or-

The number of elements in the source ICollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.

System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An IEnumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
